meanings.definition: The quality or state of being talkative.
meanings.sent1: Her talkiness made her the life of the party.
meanings.sent2: His talkiness often led to long conversations with strangers.
meanings.sent3: Despite her talkiness, she was a great listener.
meanings.sent4: The talkiness of the radio host kept listeners engaged for hours.
meanings.sent5: The talkiness of the parrot amazed everyone at the zoo.

meanings.definition: Excessive or unnecessary verbosity in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: The professor's talkiness made the lecture unbearable.
meanings.sent2: His report was full of unnecessary talkiness that confused the readers.
meanings.sent3: The talkiness of the politician's speech put everyone to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The talkiness of the novel made it difficult to follow the plot.
meanings.sent5: The talkiness of the advertisement annoyed viewers during the show.
